newsitem.title: GERMANY: PORSCHE H1 PROFITS NEARLY QUADRUPLE.
newsitem.headline: PORSCHE H1 PROFITS NEARLY QUADRUPLE.

text.p: German sportscar maker Dr. Ing. h.c.F Porsche AG said on Friday that first half net profit nearly quadrupled to 38.4 million marks ($22.7 million).

Group sales, led by robust demand for its new Boxster model and the continued popularity of the 911, jumped 25.6 percent to 1.78 billion marks. Unit car sales climbed even faster, up 32.7 percent to 13,549.
The profit figure compares with a 48.1 million mark profit for all of the 1995/96 business year which ended on July 31.
A preliminary report on Porsche's first half results was made on January 31, but today's profit figure is more than two million marks higher than was seen then.
The strong sales growth is due above all to Porsche's two-seat cabriolet Boxster model which was first introduced last autumn.
The Porsche plant, which has a capacity of around 30,000 cars a year, has been unable to keep up with demand for the model which now has an order backlog of nearly a year.
